item.title: RUGBY UNION: Richmond will take on the Championship together, says skipper Warden
item.description: Warden: “If we are going to do this we are going to do it together – even if it means getting slaughtered every week."

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Parsons prepares Sutton & Epsom for the jump to the National League
item.description: Parsons: “It is a big step up and the gulf between London One and National Three is a big one."

item.title: Harlequins: O'Shea's successor will benefit from a Challenge Cup triumph
item.description: Conor O'Shea says his replacement - whoever they might be - will inherit a squad on the up if they claim the European Challenge Cup crown.

item.title: Harlequins: Evans return hands Quins Challenge Cup boost
item.description: Director of rugby Conor O'Shea has warned fly half Nick Evans he must earn the right to displace Ben Botica in the Quins number 10 jersey.

item.title: Harlequins: Wallace could be in for busy summer after Quins awards sweep
item.description: Harlequins back row Luke Wallace could be in for a busy summer should history repeat itself after cleaning up at the club's awards dinner in Fulham on Tuesday night .

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Richmond's part-timers will get the chance to shine in the Championship
item.description: Hill: "I’ve challenged them to give it everything for 10 months to see what a squad of part-time rugby players can achieve in a full-time professional league.”

item.title: HARLEQUINS: Watch out Brown, Saracens Goode is after your England shirt
item.description: When it comes to his international place, Harlequins’ Mike Brown should be looking over his shoulder says Saracens wing Chris Ashton.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Richmond within striking distance of the Championship
item.description: Richmond took another step towards the National League One title last weekend, but director of rugby Steve Hill admitted it could have been different.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Sutton & Epsom success story is all down to the team, says Hodgson
item.description: Paul Hodgson says Sutton & Epsom’s promotion to the National Leagues is testament to how the club is run.

item.title: PICTURE GALLERY: Sutton & Epsom crowned London Division One South champions
item.description: Sutton & Epsom will be playing National League rugby next season after sealing the London Division One South title with a 25-18 win at Medway in Kent.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Harries puts pen to paper on a new London Scottish deal
item.description: Harries: “I’m delighted to have re-signed with the club, who have big ambitions and are moving forward in the right direction.”

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Sutton & Epsom's Caddy is celebrating nothing just yet
item.description: James Caddy admits taking Sutton & Epsom into the National League Three would be a proud moment, but the skipper is not planning the party just yet.

item.title: HARLEQUINS: Mulchrone will get better once he becomes a Quin
item.description: Harlequins head coach John Kingston says Worcester Warriors scrum half Charlie Mulchrone will only benefit from a switch to the Stoop.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Sutton & Epsom Ladies skipper proud of her title champions
item.description: Sutton & Epsom RFC's ladies skipper Sophie Small could not be more proud after her charges claimed the Women's NC London & SE South Division Two title.

item.title: HARLEQUINS: Marler hit with two-game ban and £20,000 fine for "gypsy boy" comment
item.description: Marler: “What I said to Samson was out of order and wrong and I am sorry it was said, we shook hands at the end of the game and looked to move on."

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Rosslyn Park coach ready for a tough test at Hartpury College
item.description: Rosslyn Park coach Scott Sneddon is under no allusions about what it will take to maintain their winning run.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: London Scottish head coach rues the fine margins between defeat and victory
item.description: London Scottish head coach Peter Richards has challenged his players to match last weekend’s performance levels – if not the result – when league leaders Bristol come to town on Saturday.

item.title: HARLEQUINS: Italy-bound O'Shea is not panicking about domestic form just yet
item.description: Harlequins director of rugby Conor O’Shea will become head coach of Italy when he steps down at the end of the season.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Sutton & Epsom boss warns against complacency
item.description: “Charlton Park were the team we beat in the play-offs a few years ago so there’s always a bit of spice in our games."

item.title: RUGBY UNION: London Scottish's fly-half racks up 50 appearances, but only has eyes on number 51
item.description: Millar: “It's our last game on our home patch so we'll be going all out for the victory."

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Harlequins skipper has a smile on his international face
item.description: Harlequins skipper Danny Care is playing with a smile on his international face again.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Richmond come through "toughest test" so far
item.description: Richmond head coach Steve Hill admitted Saturday’s 19-19 draw with Ampthill was their toughest match of the season so far.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Hodgson's promise is a step closer after Dover demolition
item.description: Hodgson said: “I always said I would have one season to try to help Sutton into the National Leagues and so far we are on the right pathway."

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Schmid's shock at axe from Esher, the club he loved
item.description: After 11 years at the club, Esher’s director of rugby Mike Schmid said he was shocked and disappointed at being axed from the club he loved.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Richmond would fulfil Championship right, says chief
item.description: Hill: "If we finish top, I can categorically say that Richmond will be in the Championship next season."

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Sutton & Epsom scrum half is not getting carried away
item.description: Sutton & Epsom may be 10 points clear at the top of London Division One South, but scrum half Paul Hodgson is not getting carried away with any thoughts of promotion.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Top of the table clash is not a title decider
item.description: Cholewa: “This is the kind of game where I don’t need to give the players a team talk, they will be more than up for it,”

item.title: RUGBY UNION: High times ahead for Sutton & Epsom youngsters
item.description: SUTTON & Epsom U11 starlet Matthew Roberts is counting down the hours until the Aviva Premiership final after booking a trip to Twickenham.

item.title: RUGBY: Trinity School U13s defy the odds to be crowned national champions
item.description: Croydon’s Trinity School director of rugby Aaron Liffchak praised his U13s’ “resilience and mental strength” after they came from behind to win the School Sports Magazine Cup final.

item.title: ROSSLYN PARK: Confidence is being restored by coaching duo ahead of Esher derby
item.description: Sneddon: “As coaches we have inherited a very good squad of players – maybe they were just lacking a little bit of confidence."

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Streatham-Croydon youngster proud despite missing out on Twickenham showpiece
item.description: STREATHAM-Croydon's U11 starlet Diran Oresanya insists he loved every minute of his Land Rover Premiership Rugby Cup experience despite missing out on a place at Twickenham.

item.title: Harlequins: Joe Marler should remain an England starter
item.description: Ex-England prop David Flatman admits he would hand the Red Rose No.1 jersey to Joe Marler at every possible opportunity, writes Jack Miller.

item.title: London Scottish: Cat in the Hat could not save Scottish from Nottingham defeat
item.description: Never mind pulling a rabbit from a hat, London Scottish signed the Cat in the Hat last week.

item.title: London Welsh: Exiles' last gasp win comes as a relief to Chris Elder
item.description: London Welsh's dramatic 21-14 win at Jersey brought a welcome change in late fortune for the Exiles this season in the Championship, writes Damian Dolan.

item.title: HARLEQUINS: Brown has all the motivation he needs for England's return to the scene of the crime
item.description: Harlequins full back Mike Brown is using his World Cup disappointment as motivation for a successful return to Twickenham this weekend.

item.title: ROSSLYN PARK: Skipper wants a Leicester City story and plans a strong end to the season
item.description: The National League One title may be beyond Rosslyn Park this season, but skipper Hugo Ellis is demanding a strong finish to the campaign.

item.title: Richmond Rugby: Richmond planning for promotion, but not counting chickens just yet
item.description: Richmond have begun planning for promotion as they sit atop the National League Division One with a 10-point gap separating them from nearest rivals Blackheath.

item.title: Harlequins: Nick Evans ruled out until May after surgery
item.description: Harlequins have confirmed fly half Nick Evans will miss the rest of the regular Premiership season.

item.title: Rugby Union: Weybridge Vandals fortunes set to turn
item.description: Weybridge Vandals coach Aidan Turns remains upbeat over his side’s battle against the London Division Two South West drop, writes Tim Redigolo.

item.title: Harlequins: Ben Botica and Tim Swiel on alert amid Nick Evans injury fears
item.description: Quins' back-up playmakers Ben Botica and Tim Swiel have been put on high alert by director of rugby Conor O'Shea with fly half Nick Evans set to miss at least six weeks - and possibly the rest of season - through injury.

item.title: PICTURE GALLERY: Sutton & Epsom are back on top
item.description: Sutton & Epsom displayed their promotion credentials with an emphatic 38-19 win over Chobham on Saturday.

item.title: London Scottish: Quins session key to downing Pirates as Scottish revival continues
item.description: London Scottish head coach Peter Richards revealed a training session with Harlequins helped inspire a fifth successive win at the weekend.

item.title: Harlequins: Sam Egerton arrives on short-term deal
item.description: Yorkshire Carnegie and England Sevens scrum-half Sam Egerton has joined Harlequins on a short-term deal with immediate effect.

item.title: Rosslyn Park: Buckland departure was no surprise, says skipper
item.description: Rosslyn Park skipper Hugo Ellis said it was no surprise that head coach James Buckland was relieved of his duties last week.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Rosslyn Park and Buckland part company
item.description: Rosslyn Park have parted company with head coach James Buckland.

item.title: Harlequins: Ben Botica clanger is water under the bridge says director of rugby Conor O'Shea
item.description: Harlequins director of Rugby Conor O’Shea says Ben Botica has moved on from his Northampton Saints howler on Saturday.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: London Scottish and their Tenacious T
item.description: FULL back Peter Lydon might have kicked the winning points, but head coach Peter Richards was in no doubt who London Scottish’s hero was in their Championship derby triumph at London Welsh on Saturday.

item.title: Harlequins: Quins quiet over Wayne Smith speculation
item.description: New Zealand coach Wayne Smith is reported to be in talks with Harlequins to become the club's new director of rugby.

item.title: Harlequins: England will wreak havoc in Italy, says full back Mike Brown
item.description: Full back Mike Brown says England intend to cause ‘chaos’ against Italy on Sunday after Saturday’s 15-9 Calcutta Cup win over Scotland.

item.title: PICTURE GALLERY: Last-gasp Peter Lydon edges Scots past London Welsh
item.description: Peter Lydon nailed his second touchline conversion in consecutive weeks to give London Scottish victory over arch rivals London Welsh at Old Deer Park, writes Oli Shapley.
